page.title: 14TRADE IN LANDRAKE (PART 1)
page.content: In the village of Landrake there is a public house,butcher's shop,general store and hairdressing salon. The Bullers Arms public house has regular customers in the form of tourists during the summer months as it has a good reputation for home cooked food. The butcher's shop is noted for its friendly personal service.Good quality meat,either fresh or supplies for your freezer, can be purchased along with fresh fruit and vegetables. The general store sells food,fresh fruit and vegetables and is a newsagents.There are also off-licence and post office counters within the store.This shop supplies most of the general needs of the village population but prices tend to be rather high and many people do most of their shopping in Saltash or Plymouth.
